summary: Worker crashes with "ValueError: Unknown Encoding" error when processing payloads from old task queue entries. The issue occurs when stale workflows from previous runs use incompatible encoding, causing the data converter to fail.
userImpact: Users encounter worker crashes when running hello world samples if old task queue entries exist, requiring task queue name changes to work around the issue.
rootCause: Payload metadata contains non-unicode characters from old workflow executions that the data converter cannot deserialize, causing the worker to fail.
proposedFix: Improve error message handling and prevent malformed payloads from killing the entire worker process.
workaround: Change task queue names to use a fresh queue without old entries.
resolutionDetails: User identified the root cause as stale task queue entries; issue resolved by changing task queue names. Worker error handling was improved to be more resilient.
keyQuote: This problem goes away when I change task queue names, so I think it may be due to an old entry in the task queue causing issues.
